its petty bad if you cant land an inspire 2 within 10' of a target. "had to navigate obstacles" or you could fly up to 100' and go over everything and come back down. sure you cant fly line of sight but the range on an Inspire is well over a mile. you could see it in 4k on the monitor. this was a dumb exercise.

replies.context: Only time I crashed into something was by line of site.  The camera give you a much better ideal of what is going on. You can't look at a drone over 500 ft away and tell its relationship to other objects.  Using the Inspire's camera you should be able to get within a foot or two of the target.  Heck I can fly a much smaller Maverick out 2 miles and be confident that I can turn the controler off. Go in the house and when I come back outside it will be within a couple of feet from where it took off.

context: Hope they are not made in China drones.
i have a 12 ga. shot gun and i will blow any drone out of the sky that comes over my property.  I don't care who or why.  Fly a drone over my house and it is dead.

replies.context: Go for it! I would also expect a knock on the door from the FBI when all is done. Shooting at a registered UAS is treated EXACTLY the same as shooting at a manned aircraft. Shoot away!
